headline: Silver Prices Crash 31% in Second Worst Day on Record
summary: Silver prices crashed 31% Friday, their second worst day on record.  February silver futures, which ended Thursday at more than $114 a troy ounce, settled Friday at $78.29.  The precious metal had a meteoric rise since then, smashing through a 45-year old record high in October and more than doubling from there.

headline: Curious about CME (CME) Q4 Performance? Explore Wall Street Estimates for Key Metrics
summary: Evaluate the expected performance of CME (CME) for the quarter ended December 2025, looking beyond the conventional Wall Street top-and-bottom-line estimates and examining some of its key metrics for better insight.

raw.headline: Curious about CME (CME) Q4 Performance? Explore Wall Street Estimates for Key Metrics

headline: Copper Falls as LME Trade Halt Caps Turbulent Week for Metals
summary: The world’s biggest metals bourse opened belatedly at 10:00 a.m Hong Kong time on Friday after standard pre-trading checks identified a potential technical issue, and the exchange ordered a precautionary delay.  After the delayed start, benchmark three-month futures fell by almost 4% to near $13,000 a ton on the LME, after peaking above $14,500 on Thursday following a sudden wave of buying by Chinese speculative investors with few precedents.  Copper has been at the heart of a remarkable period of trading, fueled by optimism over demand from the energy transition, as well as a steadily weaker US dollar, which hit a four-year low earlier this week.
